title: Jean-Claude Juncker: Brexit has been a ‘waste of time and energy’
text:
Jean-Claude Juncker on Tuesday told MEPs that dealing with Brexit during his five-year mandate was a "waste of time and energy" | Frederick Florin/AFP via Getty Images Jean-Claude Juncker: Brexit has been a ‘waste of time and energy’ Outgoing Commission president says his focus has been on how EU ‘could do better for its citizens.’

European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker on Tuesday told MEPs that dealing with Brexit during his five-year mandate was a "waste of time and energy."

Speaking before European lawmakers in the institution's plenary session in Strasbourg for the last time before his successor Ursula von der Leyen takes over, Juncker said he regretted he had spent "much of his mandate" trying to solve the Brexit issue.

"In truth, it has pained me to spend so much of this mandate dealing with Brexit when I have thought of nothing less than how this Union could do better for its citizens," a visibly annoyed Juncker said. "Waste of time, waste of energy."

European Council President Donald Tusk, who also delivered his last speech in the plenary before he steps down in December, was in a less somber mood, describing the situation in the U.K. as "quite complex." He said he is now consulting leaders on the way forward but this "very much depends on what the [U.K.] parliament decides or doesn’t decide."

The EU and the U.K. agreed on a new Brexit deal on Friday. But on Saturday, the U.K. parliament voted in favor of asking a further delay to the October 31 Brexit deadline anyway, and have yet to vote on whether they approve of the deal.

"A no-deal Brexit will never be our decision," Tusk said, prompting MEPs to applaud.
description: Outgoing Commission president says his focus has been on how EU ‘could do better for its citizens.’
